availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Fayette County, Kentucky, farmer. Scott County, Kentucky, native. Married to Margaret Stone. Father to George W. Stone, John T. Stone, Jennie Stone, Samuel R. Stone, Morrison Stone, Mary Stone, and Jacob Stone. Farmer in Fayette County, Kentucky, in 1850. Owned two enslaved persons in Fayette County in 1850. Farmer in Fayette County in 1860. Owned two enslaved persons in Fayette County in 1860.

ab.bibl:

Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Fayette County, District 2 p. 430B.

Kentucky, Wills and Probate Records, 1774-1989, Kentucky County, District, and Probate Courts, Fayette County Wills, vol. 6-7, 1881-1894, p. 323-4.
"Death Roll: Uriah Stone," Weekly Leader (Lexington, Ky.), Apr. 9, 1891, p. 7.
